p: Table 3 shows that the standard drugs (gallic acid (84.03 ± 0.002%) and rutin (64.12 ± 0.01%)) and all aqueous and ethanol extracts of the flesh and peel in M. sinensis and M. paradisiaca had peak antioxidant activity at the highest concentration gradient (0.01 mg/mL). A similar pattern existed in the acetone extracts of M. sinensis flesh (3.93 ± 0.02%) and peel (11.17 ± 0.002%) and M. paradisiaca peel (11.01 ± 0.002%).
